intro: Thrasya hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy thrasya, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
